Topic.Title: So Maybe Third Point LLC has an "ax to grind" with Citadel (and ETFC)

Message.Msg: Interesting. Clash of the titans! Lately, it's Mr. Loeb vs Mr. Ackman on Herbalife. Let's sit and watch!
this will be a $50 stock in 2015 assuming it can remain independent long enough to get there...my guess is that one or more of the money center banks will want ETFC.
Excellent discussion back and forth - good to see mature discussion on this board once again.

Topic.Title: US jobless aid applications fall to 5-year low

Message.Msg: Paying off debts seems permanently scratched out from this president's and his party's vocabulary. For small folks who could not pay their loans in and after 2008 the the word debt was real because there was a hell of a price to pay. Lots of those small debt combined lead to financial collapse of whole US economy. This little president's message to americans about US debt is - not to worry. In 2008 little debts was something to worry about, but today a large US debt is not. Makes sense. For a drone.

Message.Title: .99 cent share sale!!!!
Message.Msg: wooo hooo! ( . )( .) what a deal! Buy the suprise grab bag for .99$ !

"Just the cash set aside for loan loss translates to almost $16 per share. That is in CASH - forget the value of the company's accounts etc." Some tidy math for you my man.....Etrade has about 300mil outstanding shares. That would mean Etrade has 4.8 billion in loan loss reserves? They have about 800mil (I think) in loan loss reserves and those will all be spent on bad loans.

Topic.Title: US jobless aid applications fall to 5-year low

Message.Msg: **US jobless aid applications fall to 5-year low** Tell that to the 47 million men, women, and children on food stamps and extended unemploment benifits...and all thoes who quit even looking for work. Their not as lucky as lucky to have a government job.

Message.Title: Berry's Inaugurationl could be stinky affair
Message.Msg: Potty crisis could gum up Inauguration...couldn't happen to a more deserving bunch of folks. Something stinks on Capitol Hill and it has nothing to do with usual suspect, Congress. It is more basic: There are going to be far fewer porta-potties at President Obama's second Inauguration than his first. And while crowd estimates for Monday's event are less than half the 1.8 million who flooded the Mall in 2009, the bathroom count has been cut by about two-thirds, meaning potentially long lines at the portable restrooms. "It could be a pissy Inauguration," said John Banzhaf, the George Washington University professor whose urgings in 2009 led to more porta-potties for the president's first Inauguration.
